snippet: At least 75 people were killed, the South Sudanese interior minister said, but Reuters put the figure at at least 400 dead and up to 800 wounded.
abstract: South Sudanese Interior Min Michael Makuei Lueth says at least 75 people were killed in violent confrontations in there in midst of rising political tensions; Reuters, however, estimates that at least 400 have been killed and up to 800 wounded.

byline.contributor: Keith Bradsher contributed reporting from Tacloban, the Philippines.

lead_paragraph: At least 75 people were killed, the South Sudanese interior minister said, but Reuters put the figure at at least 400 dead and up to 800 wounded.

headline.main: Three Days of Violence in South Sudan Leave Scores Dead
headline.print_headline: Three Days of Violence in South Sudan Leave Scores Dead
